targets.expr: sum by () (ma_pg_patroni_cluster_status{namespace="$namespace", cluster=~"$cluster"} or ma_pg_metrics_running{namespace="$namespace", cluster=~"$cluster", pg_node='External'})
targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM /pg.$cluster_name.cluster.status/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter
SELECT last("value") FROM /pg.$cluster_name.cluster.status/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter

panels.description: Postgres server version
panels.title: Version

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM /pg.$cluster_name.nodes.node.*.pg_metrics.running/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.description: Shows whether metric sources work. If the value is greater than 1, then the source returns error. If the value is zero, then the source is down.

targets.query: select 1 - ( max("value") / 14 - max("value") % 14 / 14)  from /ma.status/  WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by service_name, time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Metric Sources (1 = OK)

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM /pg.$cluster_name.nodes.node.*.patroni_status/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.description: Shows whether the cluster serves RW requests (select, insert, update, delete) through the endpoint.
panels.title: Smoke Test

panels.description: Shows the execution time for a **single** RW request (select, insert, update, delete) through the endpoint.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg.$cluster_name.endpoints.cluster.smoketest.delete.*time_ms$/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Smoke Tests Timings

panels.description: Shows whether monitoring is able to connect to PostgreSQL through the endpoint.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg.$cluster_name.endpoints.cluster.running/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Endpoint Cluster Status (1 = Running)

panels.description: Shows CPU consumption in PostgreSQL pods based on metrics collected from docker. This section does not use collector metrics.

targets.expr: sum(rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total{image!="", container!="POD", namespace="$namespace", pod="$namespace_pods", cluster=~"$cluster"}[2m])) by (pod_name, container)
targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM "cpu/usage_rate" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND "container_name" = '$container_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), pod_name fill(null)

panels.title: CPU Usage: $namespace_pods

panels.description: Shows memory consumption in PostgreSQL pods based on metrics collected from docker. This section does not use collector metrics.

targets.query: SELECT max("value") FROM "memory/usage" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND  "container_name" = '$container_name'  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), pod_name  fill(null)

SELECT max("value") FROM "memory/working_set" WHERE "type" = 'pod_container' AND "namespace_name" = '$namespace' AND  "container_name" = '$container_name' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), pod_name  fill(null)

panels.title: Memory Usage: $namespace_pods

panels.description: Shows objects and chunks count for PG Large Objects.
panels.title: Large Objects Count

panels.description: Shows total size of PG Large objects in bytes.
panels.title: Size of large objects

panels.description: Shows the number of connections to PostgreSQL pods.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.node\d+\..*\.current_connections/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by service_name, time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Current Connections

panels.description: Shows the number of replication connections to PostgreSQL pods.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.node\d+\..*pg_metrics\.replication_connections/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by service_name, time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Replication Connections

panels.description: Estimated value for transactions per second. Calculated as transaction amount for last 30 seconds divided by 30.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("value"), 1s) FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.node\d+.*\.pg_metrics\.xact_sum/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: TPS

panels.description: Shows disk usage for PostgreSQL pods.

targets.query: SELECT /value/ FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.node\d+.*\.metrics\.df\.pcent/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by service_name

panels.title: Disk Usage Percentage

panels.description: Shows usage by well-known consumers, such as pg_xlog or base directories.

targets.query: SELECT /value/ FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.$short_container_name\.metrics\.du\.(.?)/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by service_name

panels.title: Disk Usage

panels.description: Shows current DB count in PostgreSQL pods.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.node\d+.*\.pg_metrics\.db_count/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: DataBases Count

panels.description:
Shows current XLOG location. This value is correlated with the transaction count, or the number of changes made to the database.
The master and replica should have the same value, with a short period while the replica catches up to the master. 
The value on the replica can be slightly less than the master's, but should increase over time.

targets.query: select /value/ from /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.node\d+.*\.pg_metrics\.xlog_location/ where namespace = '$namespace' and $timeFilter

panels.title: XLOG Location

panels.description: Number of locks from pg_locks view.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.node\d+.*\.pg_metrics\.locks$/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Locks

panels.description: Number of locks from pg_locks view that are not granted.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\.nodes\.node\d+.*\.pg_metrics\.locks_not_granted/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)

panels.title: Locks not granted

panels.description:
This like the "Smoke test" section, with one difference - this section executes smoketests directly on the master pod.
The difference in execution allows distinguishing between cases of master unavailability and endpoint failure.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM /pg.$cluster_name.nodes.*.smoketest.delete.*check$/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Smoke Test

panels.description:
This like the "Smoke test" section, with one difference - this section executes smoketests directly on the master pod.
 The difference in execution allows distinguishing between cases of master unavailability and endpoint failure.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM/pg.$cluster_name.nodes.*.smoketest.delete.*time_ms$/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Smoke Tests Timings

panels.description: Shows the size of the last backup.

targets.query: SELECT last(value) FROM "ma.storage.last.metrics.size" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Last Version Size

panels.description:
Shows the space occupied by backups and the remaining amount of space. 
Not all storage supports total size, so "Total Volume Space" metrics can be zeroed.

targets.query: SELECT last(value) FROM /storage\.size/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT last(value) FROM /storage\.total_space/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Storage Size/Free Space

panels.description: Shows time spent on last backup.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM /storage\.lastSuccessful\.metrics\.spent_time/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter  GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Time Spent on Backup

panels.description: Shows the changes of activity status on the chart.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "ma.backup_is_in_progress" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Activity Status

panels.description:
Backup status shows the state of the backup daemon. The backup status can be one of following:
 
* OK - There is at least one successful backup, and the latest backup is successful.
* WARNING - There are no successful backups, or the last backup failed.

targets.query: SELECT last(value) FROM /status/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Last Backup Status

panels.description: Shows the backup storage type.

targets.query: SELECT last(value) FROM "ma.storage.type" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter

panels.title: Storage Type

panels.description:
Shows the current activity status of the backup daemon. The activity status can be one of following:
* Not Active - There is no running backup process.
* In Progress - The backup process is running.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "ma.backup_is_in_progress" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Activity Status

panels.description: Shows the period of time when the last successful backup process was ended.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "ma.storage.lastSuccessful.end_timestamp_ago" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Time of Last Successful Backup

panels.description: Shows the period of time when the last backup process was ended.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "ma.storage.last.end_timestamp_ago" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Time of Last Backup

panels.description: Shows the number of backups that will be evicted next time.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "ma.storage.outdated_backup_count" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter  GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Outdated Backup Count

panels.description: Shows the time when backup and eviction will be started.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "ma.backup.time_until_next_backup" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Next Backup

panels.description: Shows the amount of successful backups.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "ma.storage.successful_dump_count" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Successful Backup Versions Count

panels.description: Shows the amount of available backups.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM "ma.storage.dump_count" WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Backup Versions Count

panels.description: If archive mode is on, then the WAL archive is enabled. Otherwise, the WAL archive is disabled.

targets.query: SELECT last("value") FROM /pg.$cluster_name.*.archive.mode/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter

panels.title: Archive mode

panels.description: Shows the time in seconds since the last WAL file was archived. If rotation is disabled, and load on server is close to zero, this value can reach thousand of seconds.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM/pg.$cluster_name.nodes.*.archive.delay$/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Archive Lag, s

panels.description: Shows the amount of failed attempts to flush WAL files to archive. If this value is greater than 0, the system checks whether backup daemon is running and has enough space to store files.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM/pg.$cluster_name.nodes.*.archive.failed_count/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Failed to archive

panels.description: Shows the space occupied by WAL archive and the remaining amount of space. Not all storage supports total size, so "Total Volume Space" metrics can be zeroed.

targets.query: SELECT last(value) FROM /storage\.archive_size/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and service_name='postgres-backup-daemon' and $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Storage Size/Free Space

panels.description: Shows the difference between the current XLOG location and the data that was sent to recipient.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\..*\.pg_metrics\.replication\.(.*).sent_lag/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Sent lag

panels.description: Shows the difference between the sent XLOG location and applied to the recipient XLOG location.

targets.query: SELECT mean(value) FROM /pg\.$cluster_name\..*\.pg_metrics\.replication\.(.*).sent_replay_lag/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(null)

panels.title: Sent/Replay lag

targets.query: SELECT value FROM /collector.duration/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter fill(null)

panels.description: This graph shows size for all of the logical databases in PostgreSQL cluster.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") / 1024 / 1024 FROM /pg.common.size_by_database.*/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: Size by database

panels.description: This graph shows number of table in each of the logical databases.
panels.title: Number of Tables

panels.description: Shows how many connections are in use right now. It shows max connections, used connections, reserved for regular, and superuser.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg.common.connection_count_stat.*/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: Overall connection statistic

panels.description: Shows the number of connections per database.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg.common.connection_by_database.*/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: Connection by database

panels.description: Shows the number of connections per role.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg.common.connection_by_database.*/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: Connection by role

panels.description: Shows the number of not idle connections per database.

targets.query: SELECT mean("value") FROM /pg.common.count_not_idle.*/ WHERE namespace='$namespace' and $timeFilter group by time($interval) fill(previous)

panels.title: Not idle connections by Database

panels.description: This table shows number of Active Connections in current moment by role. Also shows Connection Limits that is set during Role create. Also, shows not idle connection by role.

targets.query: SELECT top("$column", $limit) as "$column", "short_query", "datname", "mean_time", "queryid" FROM (SELECT LAST("queryid_val"), * FROM "ma.pg.common.queries_stat" WHERE $timeFilter and ("datname" = '$datname' OR 'All' = '$datname' ) and "namespace" = '$namespace'  GROUP BY "queryid" ORDER BY DESC LIMIT 1) ORDER BY DESC

panels.title: Number of Active Connections by Role

panels.description: The table shows TOP tables filtered by the selected database name.

targets.expr: sum by (relid, relname, datname, selector) (ma_pg_table_size_by_db{namespace="$namespace", datname=~"$datname", cluster=~"$cluster", relname=~"$top_tables_by_size"})
targets.query: SELECT top("$column", $limit) as "$column", "short_query", "datname", "mean_time", "queryid" FROM (SELECT LAST("queryid_val"), * FROM "ma.pg.common.queries_stat" WHERE $timeFilter and ("datname" = '$datname' OR 'All' = '$datname' ) and "namespace" = '$namespace'  GROUP BY "queryid" ORDER BY DESC LIMIT 1) ORDER BY DESC

targets.expr: sum by (relid, relname, datname, selector) (ma_pg_tuples_by_db{namespace="$namespace", datname=~"$datname", cluster=~"$cluster", relname=~"$top_tables_by_size"})
sum by (relid, relname, datname, selector) (ma_pg_tot_size_by_db{namespace="$namespace", datname=~"$datname", cluster=~"$cluster", relname=~"$top_tables_by_size"})
sum by (relid, relname, datname, selector) (ma_pg_idx_size_by_db{namespace="$namespace", datname=~"$datname", cluster=~"$cluster", relname=~"$top_tables_by_size"})

panels.title: TOP $limit tables by size

panels.description: This Graph Shows size of the each table in all of the databases
panels.title: Size by tables

panels.description: This graphs shows estimated number of rows in all of the tables, using `pg_stat_all_tables` system view.
panels.title: Estimated Number of Rows per Table

panels.description:
The table shows TOP queries filtered by the selected column and database name.  For queries statistics `pg_stat_statements`  view used. More info about columns could be find in official docs.

Also, it is possible to reset the statistics, by calling `pg_stat_statements_reset()` function.

targets.query: SELECT top("$column", $limit) as "$column", "short_query", "datname", "mean_time", "queryid" FROM (SELECT LAST("queryid_val"), * FROM "ma.pg.common.queries_stat" WHERE $timeFilter and ("datname" = '$datname' OR 'All' = '$datname' ) and "namespace" = '$namespace'  GROUP BY "queryid" ORDER BY DESC LIMIT 1) ORDER BY DESC

panels.title: TOP $limit queries by $column

targets.expr: sum by (datname, db_namespace, microservice, tenant_id) (last_over_time(ma_pg_dbaas{namespace="$namespace", cluster=~"$cluster"}[$__range:]))

list.definition: query_result(topk($limit, sum by (relid, datname, relname) (last_over_time(ma_pg_table_size_by_db{namespace="$namespace", datname=~"$datname", cluster=~"$cluster"}[$__range:]))))
list.name: top_tables_by_size

query.query: query_result(topk($limit, sum by (relid, datname, relname) (last_over_time(ma_pg_table_size_by_db{namespace="$namespace", datname=~"$datname", cluster=~"$cluster"}[$__range:]))))
